content.question: <math overflow="scroll"> <msub> <mi>PCl</mi> <mn>3</mn> </msub> <mo>,</mo> <msub> <mi>Cl</mi> <mn>2</mn> </msub> <mo>,</mo> <msub> <mi>CaCl</mi> <mn>2</mn> </msub> </math> Which of the following correctly ranks the substances listed above in order of increasing ionic character in their bonding?

choices.label: <math alttext="C l 2" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>Cl</mi><mn>2</mn></msub></math>, <math alttext="P C l 3" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>PCl</mi><mn>3</mn></msub></math>, <math alttext="C a C l 2" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>CaCl</mi><mn>2</mn></msub></math>

<math alttext="C l 2" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>Cl</mi><mn>2</mn></msub></math>, <math alttext="C a C l 2" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>CaCl</mi><mn>2</mn></msub></math>, <math alttext="P C l 3" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>PCl</mi><mn>3</mn></msub></math>

<math alttext="C a C l 2" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>CaCl</mi><mn>2</mn></msub></math>, <math alttext="P C l 3" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>PCl</mi><mn>3</mn></msub></math>, <math alttext="C l 2" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>Cl</mi><mn>2</mn></msub></math>

<math alttext="C a C l 2" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>CaCl</mi><mn>2</mn></msub></math>, <math alttext="C l 2" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>Cl</mi><mn>2</mn></msub></math>, <math alttext="P C l 3" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>PCl</mi><mn>3</mn></msub></math>

content.answer: <math alttext="C l 2" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>Cl</mi><mn>2</mn></msub></math>, <math alttext="P C l 3" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>PCl</mi><mn>3</mn></msub></math>, <math alttext="C a C l 2" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>CaCl</mi><mn>2</mn></msub></math>

skill.text: 1.A: Describe the components of and quantitative information from models and representations that illustrate particulate-level properties only.
